meanings.definition: A large bird with long legs and a long neck, typically found in open grasslands.
meanings.sent1: The bustard strutted gracefully across the grassy field.
meanings.sent2: I spotted a bustard while hiking in the savanna.
meanings.sent3: Why did the bustard refuse to play hide-and-seek? Because it always stood out!
meanings.sent4: The bustard soared through the sky like a majestic ruler of the grasslands.
meanings.sent5: The bustard's long legs and neck make it a unique sight in the open plains.

meanings.sent1: Please be careful not to bustard the delicate vase.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally bustard the window while playing baseball.
meanings.sent3: Why did the clumsy chef bustard the eggs? Because he couldn't crack them properly!
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds threatened to bustard the old tree in the yard.
meanings.sent5: The angry driver wanted to bustard the car in frustration.

meanings.definition: A type of thick, strong glassware.
meanings.sent1: The fancy restaurant served drinks in beautiful bustard glasses.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate designs on the bustard tumblers.
meanings.sent3: Why did the bustard glass refuse to break? Because it was made of special material!
meanings.sent4: The sunlight reflected off the bustard pitcher, creating a dazzling display.
meanings.sent5: The bustard goblets were perfect for toasting on special occasions.
